content:
I've edited the statement just now:

* Reformatted commands and parameters.

* Revised the upper limit of [[N]] from 2000 to 10.

Some issues with the space characters used in the new cases. As discussed previously here, the specification has never mentioned that they can be used to separate commands. Only semi-colons should be used. Any changes to the specification should be dealt with in Part 3 now.

Test 6
Original: RP 2 [setpc Hello] rt 90 fd 5
Should be: RP 2 [setpc Hello];rt 90;fd 5

Validator 6
Original: RP 2 [setpc olleh] rt 90 fd 5
Should be: RP 2 [setpc olleh];rt 90;fd 5

Test 7
Original: RP 2 [RP 2 [fd 5 rt 90 setpc +] ; RP 2 [fd 5 rt 90 setpc *]]
Should be: RP 2 [RP 2 [fd 5;rt 90;setpc +];RP 2 [fd 5;rt 90;setpc *]]

Validator 7
Original: RP 2 [RP 2 [fd 8 rt 90 setpc +] ; RP 2 [fd 8 rt 90 setpc *]]
Should be: RP 2 [RP 2 [fd 8;rt 90;setpc +];RP 2 [fd 8;rt 90;setpc *]]

Test 8
Original: rt 90; RP 4 [fd 3 lt 90 rp 2 [fd 3 rt 90] fd 3 lt 90 fd 3 rt 90]
Should be: rt 90;RP 4 [fd 3;lt 90;rp 2 [fd 3;rt 90];fd 3;lt 90;fd 3;rt 90]

Validator 8
Original: rt 90; RP 4 [fd 4 lt 90 rp 2 [fd 4 rt 90] fd 4 lt 90 fd 4 rt 90]
Should be: rt 90;RP 4 [fd 4;lt 90;rp 2 [fd 4;rt 90];fd 4;lt 90;fd 4;rt 90]

Test 9
Original: rp 2 [rt 45]; RP 4 [fd 3 rp 2 [lt 45] rp 2 [fd 3 rp 2 [rt 45]] fd 3 rp 2 [lt 45] fd 3 rp 2 [lt 45]]
Should be: rp 2 [rt 45];RP 4 [fd 3;rp 2 [lt 45];rp 2 [fd 3;rp 2 [rt 45]];fd 3;rp 2 [lt 45];fd 3;rp 2 [lt 45]]

Validator 9
Original: rp 2 [rt 45]; RP 4 [fd 4 rp 2 [lt 45] rp 2 [fd 4 rp 2 [rt 45]] fd 4 rp 2 [lt 45] fd 4 rp 2 [lt 45]]
Should be: rp 2 [rt 45];RP 4 [fd 4;rp 2 [lt 45];rp 2 [fd 4;rp 2 [rt 45]];fd 4;rp 2 [lt 45];fd 4;rp 2 [lt 45]]

Thanks.

Test 5 and Validator 5: there is no space between {{loop}} and the {{[commands]}}:
rp 2[rt 45
instead of
rp 2 [rt 45

This possibility should be mentioned in Goal section. Thanks.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very nice evolution of the first part! Waiting for the sequel with a third episode?

Some suggested edits to try on:

Instead of "with the ability for our Turtle to", try "by giving the Turtle the ability to".

Instead of "(so to check how resilient is your first implementation to the never ending dance of changing requirements)", try "(to check your first implementation's resiliency to the never-ending dance of changing requirements)". (Regardless of how you go, never-ending should be hyphenated.)

As my eyes get older and older, a bit of white space really helps my reading. For us older folk, please consider breaking the goal up with a blank line in each of the following locations:

- above "Commands from part one (not modified):
- above "Modified commands:"
- above "New command:"
- above "For example:"

In the PENUP specification, please capitalize Turtle for consistency.

"As is part one," should be "As in part one,"

Should your reference to Part 1 actually point here:

https://www.codingame.com/training/medium/ascii-art-with-logo-language

I don't think you want to point back to the original contribution, do you?

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice part 2.  The "never ending dance of changing requirements" is (imho) a good idea, my solution for the part 1 was not ready for the changes -- and there were some unexpected parsing errors with the provided tests, which required a more robust parser.

In the second last line "parte" should say "part".

I love this kind of puzzle; it was fun to code.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: very interesting

Thanks for the part 2 :)

Two small comments:
- The default pen value ("#") should be given,
- I don't think the SETPC argument can contain '[' and ']'; I think it should be mentioned...

Goal section
* Please change "turtle" to "Turtle" (after "LEFT").
* You may format '12345' as a {{constant}} and remove the quotation marks.

Constraints section
* Please change "a ASCII" to "an ASCII".

Cases
* Will any cases be added and test SETPC with more than 2 characters ?

Thanks.
Fixed, I'm trying to produce some nice asciiarts, but I have some difficulties with the output length, do you know what the limit is? Thanks.

I agree the defaults should be given here too (heading north, pen down & # as symbol)
I also think you should also mention the commands that did not change from part 1 here, someone solving this might not have just done part 1 and would not remember what the other commands do and having to go check on the other puzzle each time might not be optimal.

Fixed Thanks! (parte is the italian for part :-)  )
I'm thinking to extend the puzzle (part 3) with Bresenham algorith for lines with any angle, what do you think?
Fixed!
I'm old too (age>0x36) so thanks for your suggestions, I think I fixed all :-)
Yes I hope soon. Thanks

Along these same lines, Test 1 and Validator 1 have trailing spaces, while Test 4 and Validator 4 have a bunch of preceding spaces. I am just now working through a solution and this is all easy enough to fix in my code, but I just want to check. Is this all on purpose?

If the things I mentioned are indeed on purpose and the things @5DN1L mentioned are also on purpose, maybe you just mention that white space is optional in Logo Language. You can have it or you can omit it. What matters is the order of the characters that make up the commands.

Correct me if I'm wrong, but I think ALL white space could be eliminated from every test case and validator and everything would still work...as long as you specified that white space is not required in Logo Language. I'm not suggesting that you do that. I'm just pointing out the complexity of the issue.

I think it might be best to do 1 of 2 things:

1) Clean up the trailing spaces and preceding spaces and the irregularities @5DN1L mentioned

or

2) Just mention that white space is completely optional in Logo Language. If you go this route, I'd like to see another test case and validator added that completely eliminate all white space. And, then you could have another test case and validator that have a bunch of EXTRA white space all throughout the commands.
Fixed, sorry about that, I forgot the spaces issue in part 2
By the way...I vote for option 2.
Yeah, option 2 is probably better than my original suggestion :)

Accordind to logo syntax "spaces are the most common way to separate one element from another". That said, I agree and in these examples the space would be unnecessary, but with procedures and variables (part 3 coming soon) it becomes necessary. So i fixed the test/val 5. As for the spaces of the test 4, they depend on test case generator (written in python). I would leave them because in part 3 they will serve to justify the procedures. what do you think?

The statement must contain all the specifications that are utilised in the test cases.

Actually I was also confused by the use of a semicolon in Test 1 / Validator 1. The statement to part 1 of the puzzle says

"Multiple instructions on the same line are separated with semicolon ;"

In Test 1 / Validator 1, the instructions are not used on the same line, nor are the semicolons used to separate instructions on the same line...

Similarly, how the spaces are used in the input should be consistent with the statement.

Fixed test/val 1.
"Similarly, how the spaces are used in the input should be consistent with the statement." I'm not sure I understand, I fixed some extra spaces. Let me know if it is ok now. Thanks

If extra spaces are not going to be tested in this puzzle (Part 2) yet, the extra spaces in Test 3 / Validator 3 have to be removed too.

[ Rp 2...
becomes
[Rp 2...

Thanks.
what an eye! fixed. Thanks
Has the change been saved?

Of course...now :-( 
Thanks!
part 3 in out.
Yes!  Curves? Flood fill? Procedures?

@Eulero314 - Did you participate in Cultist Wars last year? I really struggled with getting my Bresenham algorithm to function properly. If you were able to copy the Bresenham spec from Cultist Wars, that might be very helpful as a practice tool for Codingamers playing with Cultist Wars or any other challenge using the Bresenham line algorithm.

I felt like there was something slightly different about the Cultist Wars spec vs all the implementations I found on the Internet. I'll give it another look one of these days and see if I can remember what it was.

Hi, no I did not participate in Cultist Wars.
This is the link? 
https://www.codingame.com/multiplayer/bot-programming/cultist-wars

I'm having some trouble with Bresenham in the new part 3 (which also includes recursive variables and procedures). I think I'll post something today for tips.
part 3 is out. no flood fill sorry :-)

What would happen if you use SETPC with a string shorter than the current value of the index for cycling characters, does the index reset each time you use SEPTC?

For example:
1
RT 90;SETPC CODEINGAME;FD 6;SETPC HI;FD 2;
Done. Thanks to both of you

Thank you.

Sorry, I don't know the limit... I think some people on Discord know.
